page.title: 02Motorways West Bromwich
page.content: THE M5 MOTORWAY runs through the centre of our block,from south to north and at the northern end has the {M5 &M6 interchange.}The building of the{MOTORWAY}began in{MARCH}1967. The contract for the five and a half miles between Birmingham Road ,West Bromwich and Ray Hall Interchange was undertaken by{W.C. French.}It was built at a cost of{Â£5,870,000 and included the construction of eight bridges, one canal aquaduct and more then a mile of viaduct. R.M. Douglas built the 2 mile of the M6 between Ray Hall Interchange. Taylor Woodrow built 2.8 miles of motorway from Darlaston Road, Walsall and the Ray Hall Interchange .Most of the manual labour was recruited locally, some of the men worked over 80 hours a week during good weather and earned over Â£400 a week.
